item.title: Report X-2024100712
item.description:
Report X-2024100712

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/6/2024 at approximately 2300, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Hub Security in Indianapolis, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 4 wooden pallets, each supporting a large fiberboard gaylords, containing used cell phones and cell phone batteries. The shipment was discovered by security after collapsing under the weight of the inner contents, revealing the cell phones. The shipments were not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, and paperwork. The shipment was held for the FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024100302
item.description:
Report E-2024100302

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: PRINCETON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 8, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2924 was punctured and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental and Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum that was labeled as salvaged material for return to the terminal. The released material had dried by the time crews arrived, so crews inspected the trailer to ensure no further remediation was needed.

item.title: Report E-2024100313
item.description:
Report E-2024100313

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: EDINBURGH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1240 ET, Rachel with XPO-XCM notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of weld on duit 411 gray released from a metal pail due to improper loading, box fell crushing some of the pails inside the cardboard box The release impacted just inside the cardboard box. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
